name: osreboot/Demo-Shadow-Mapping
description: Real-time old fashioned shadow mapping demo, with home-brewed matrix math so I can get some more practice.

name: ShreyansPatell/Data_Structures_Practice_Problems
description: Collection of different practice problems for some basic data structures. The problem statement of each exercise is given on the top of the code.

name: ShreyansPatell/Artificial_Intelligence_Morris_Game_Variant
description: In this project, we develop a player logic for a variant of the Morris game using AI concepts.

name: ShreyansPatell/Parallel_Programming_Using_Threads_And_Locks
description: In this exercise, you will explore parallel programming with threads and locks using a hash table. You should do this on a computer with multiple cores (verify by running ‘cat /proc/cpuinfo’).

name: ShreyansPatell/XV6_Print_Page_Tables
description: To help visualize page tables, you need to write a function that prints the contents of the page tables.

name: ShreyansPatell/XV6_Add_System_Call
description: In this exercise, you will write a new system call getreadcount() for xv6 OS.

name: ShreyansPatell/XV6_Increase_Max_File_Size_Limit
description: In this exercise, you'll increase the maximum size of an xv6 file. You'll change the xv6 file system code to support a "doubly-indirect" block in each inode, containing 128 addresses of singly-indirect blocks, each of which can contain up to 128 addresses of data blocks.

name: ShreyansPatell/File_System_Consistency_Checker
description: In this project, you will be developing a program to check the file system consistency. The program, called as fcheck, reads a file system image and checks its consistency. When the image is not consistent, fcheck should output appropriate error message.

name: ShreyansPatell/Seeking_Tutor_Problem
description: Using POSIX threads, mutex locks, and semaphores implement a solution that synchronizes the activities of the coordinator, tutors, and the students. Your program should work for any number of students, tutors, chairs and help sought. Allocate memory for data structures dynamically based on the input parameter(s).

name: ShreyansPatell/XV6_RR_To_Lottery_Scheduler
description: In this project, you will replace the current round robin scheduler in xv6 with a lottery scheduler.

name: cwbriones/bootstrap-scheme
description: A Scheme interpreter being implemented in C++ for fun.

name: asford/tmalign
description: TMalign clone.

name: prashanth08/Web-Exploit-Scanner
description: In this project, a HTTP proxy was implemented which can interact with a virtual machine and replay contents from a server(web page) and detect if it is malicious or not. This web exploit scanner can detect malicious websites/domains and report it back to the client browser. The HTTP proxy will handle connections to the client (browser), server (web page) and virtual machine via sockets. It keeps track of the web pages parsed in a local file cache (~64KB).
